channel.title: Comments on: Run SSIS Package from Stored Procedure
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: dave
item.dc:creator: dave
item.content:encoded:
Hi Ted, Chris

Chris I need to do the same as you. That is I need to kick off a job, monitor status and returns sucess/faliure all within a storepd proc. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

dave

item.title: By: Chris
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.content:encoded:
Hello Ted,

I have a doubt… as far as I know, if I execute the sp start_job will only start the job, but will not wait until the finish of the execution . Do you know a “work around” to force the sp to wait until the end of the process?

Thanks in advance.

Regards

item.title: By: Michael
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.content:encoded:
I wish there was an easy way to start a SQL Agent job and wait for it complete along with the information about if it was successful or errored out.

That is the main reason we still use xp_cmdshell

item.title: By: ArthurZ
item.dc:creator: ArthurZ
item.description: An excellent post, it must help many visiting the MSDN SSIS Forum to cope with this endeavor more easily, thank you.
item.content:encoded: An excellent post, it must help many visiting the MSDN SSIS Forum to cope with this endeavor more easily, thank you.
